description: From Middle English forwandrien, equivalent to for- +â€Ž wander.

verbs.description: forwander (third-person singular simple present forwanders, present participle forwandering, simple past and past participle forwandered)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, UK dialectal) To wander until weary; wander far and wide.
examples: Ah, I am full weary, lief, let me sleep, Forwandered and walked in this forest.

entries.meaning: (transitive, UK dialectal) To weary with wandering; cause to wander until weary.
examples: The Lent term had pulled me down, a week of modest enjoyment thereafter in town had finished the work; and I drank in the sharp moorish air like a thirsty man who has been forwandered among deserts.
